Situation1: Their family members have recently emphasized the importance of maintaining long-held customs.
Expectation2: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation2: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Story: I stood in the cramped kitchen, the scent of incense and simmering broth thick in the air. My mother’s voice echoed from the living room, reminding me to help set up the ancestral altar—today was the anniversary of my grandfather’s passing, and every detail had to be perfect. My father glanced at me, his eyes full of expectation, silently urging me to honor our family’s traditions. Just as I reached for the ceremonial candles, my phone buzzed urgently. It was the factory supervisor: a critical bearing was screeching, threatening to bring the entire production line to a halt. They needed me—only I knew how to fix it quickly. My hands trembled as I stared at the phone, the weight of my family’s expectations pressing down on me, while the responsibility to keep the machines running pulled me in the opposite direction. I could feel my heart pounding, torn between the duty to my family and the demands of my job, knowing that whatever I chose, something important would be left undone.
